page.title: 09Sorbie Primary School
page.content: Sorbie primary{school}is the only{ {education}establishment in Sorbie. It had approximately 124 pupils early this century. An attendance officer visited the school twice a week and the school was called Sorbie Public School.Since then the {school roll}has fallen dramatically and is now only 23. In 1978 there was a threat to close the school because of the small numbers, but this did not happen. In 1982, the Moderator of the Church of Scotland visited us and told us about his job, and showed us his special ring. Every year we take part in the dancing and music{festivals.}We also enter the area sports. At the end of the summer term we go on an outing. This year we are going to the Magnum Sports Centre near Irvine, to go swimming and ice skating.
